prerequisites.title: Before You Start
prerequisites.item1: You need a web browser (desktop or mobile phone browser)
prerequisites.item2: Log into vivino.com (not the mobile app)
prerequisites.item3: Have your Vivino account credentials ready

step1.title: Go to Vivino Website
step1.description: Open your web browser (Safari, Chrome, Firefox, etc.) and navigate to vivino.com. Log in with your Vivino account.
step1.tip: You can do this on desktop or on your phone's browser (Safari, Chrome, etc.), but NOT in the Vivino mobile app.
step1.warning: Do not use the Vivino mobile app - it does not support export.

step2.title: Navigate to My Wines
step2.description: Once logged in, go to your wine list. The exact navigation may vary depending on Vivino's current interface:

option1.title: Option A: Profile Menu
option1.description: Click your profile icon (top right) ‚Üí "My Wines" or "My Cellar"

step2.tip: Vivino's interface changes occasionally. Look for sections like "My Profile", "My Account", or "My Wines".

howItWorks.title: How Vivino Export Works
howItWorks.description: Vivino allows you to export your data, but it requires a manual request. The Vivino team will prepare your export and notify you when it's ready (usually within 24-48 hours).

substep1.title: Click your profile picture
substep1.description: In the top-right corner of the Vivino website, click on your profile picture or avatar.

substep2.title: Go to Settings ‚Üí Account Management
substep2.description: From the dropdown menu, select "Settings", then navigate to the "Account Management" tab.

substep3.title: Request data export
substep3.description: Look for "Export your data" section and click "Start an export" or similar button. Vivino will start preparing your data.

substep4.title: Wait for email & download
substep4.description: Vivino will email you when your export is ready (24-48 hours). Return to the same page and click "Ready to download" to get your CSV file.

timing.title: Processing Time
timing.description: Vivino's team manually processes export requests. You'll receive an email when your data is ready to download.

alternative.title: Don't want to wait? Use our template
alternative.description: If you prefer to start immediately or have a small collection, download our CSV template and enter your wines manually:

step4.title: Import to Wine Cellar Brain
step4.description: Once you have your CSV file ready (from the template or another method), import it here:
step4.substep1: Close this guide and click "Choose CSV File"
step4.substep3: We'll auto-detect the columns (or you can map them manually)
step4.substep4: Click "Import Bottles" and we'll add them to your cellar!

success.title: Success!
success.description: Your wines will appear in your cellar. You can edit details, add sommelier notes, and get recommendations.

q1.title: I requested the export but haven't received it yet
q1.answer: Vivino's export process is manual and can take 24-48 hours. Check your email (including spam folder) for a notification from Vivino. If it's been more than 48 hours, you can request again or contact Vivino support.

q2.title: My CSV file isn't importing correctly
q2.answer: Make sure your CSV follows our template format: Wine, Producer, Vintage, Type, Region, Country, Rating, etc. Check for proper comma separation and no special characters that break CSV format.

q3.title: This is too much work - is there an easier way?
q3.answer: Yes! You can add bottles manually one-by-one using our "Add Bottle" feature, or upload photos of wine labels for quick entry. For large collections, the CSV template is still the fastest bulk method.
